title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Why Everyone Should Care about Hospice & The region's first Hospice House
description: Hospice of Northeast Georgia Medical Center (NGMC) is changing the way our community understands end-of-life care — from home-based hospice to the region’s first freestanding Hospice House, now under construction in Gainesville. As a Level 5 We Honor Veterans Partner and recipient of the Hospice Honors Elite award (placing it among the nation’s top 5% of hospices), Hospice of NGMC is built on a promise: compassionate, patient-centered care for everyone, regardless of ability to pay. In this presentation, Dr. Mary Keith will explain what hospice and palliative care truly mean, why these services matter long before the final days, and how NGMC’s expanding programs — including the upcoming Hospice House — offer peace, comfort and connection for patients and families. If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

With about 20,000 students, UNG is one of the state's largest public universities with five campuses united by a single mission focused on academic excellence. Dr. Shannon, a retired U.S. Army officer, joined UNG in 2023 and formerly served as interim chief business officer at the Georgia Institute of Technology. ung.edu $8.00 Member $15.00 Non-Member Light breakfast included 230 E.E. title: Small Business Seminar - “Preparing for an OSHA Inspection"
description: Preparing for an OSHA Inspection Tuesday, February 10 Networking 8:15 - 8:30 AM Seminar 8:30 - 9:30 AM Join us for “Preparing for an OSHA Inspection,” a practical session designed to help small businesses understand OSHA regulations and strengthen workplace safety. Experts J acob Hansen, Matt Thompson, and Jared Bostrom of Burnette Insurance will walk you through key compliance requirements and introduce helpful tools to support ongoing safety efforts. Whether you're new to OSHA standards or looking to refresh your knowledge, this session offers clear, actionable guidance. title: Arbor Day
description: The community’s Annual Arbor Day Celebration is Friday, February 20 at 10 a.m. at Elachee Nature Science Center . Open to the public, the event is coordinated by the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce and sponsored by the Hall County Master Gardeners , Keep Hall Beautiful and Georgia Power . Festivities include student contest recognition and a joint City of Gainesville/Hall County proclamation with Tree City USA recognition. The Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce Beautification Committee and the Georgia Forestry Service will recognize winners of the 2026 Arbor Day Student Art and Essay Contest. Dozens of student art and essay entries were submitted with the topic “I Speak for the Trees.” For information on Arbor Day or other Greater Hall Chamber Community Development programs, including Agribusiness programs and Business & Residential Beautification Awards, contact Robin Halstead, Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce, 770-532-6206 x 101. Email: rhalstead@ghcc.com 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Business Showcase 2026
description: Business Showcase Tuesday, February 24, 2026 2:00 - 5:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center *Booth Space is SOLD OUT* Registration for the Showcase Social is STILL OPEN! Discover the heartbeat of our local economy at the Business Showcase , where businesses from across the region come together to highlight their products, services, and innovations. Whether you're a fellow business owner, a professional looking to expand your network, or a curious community member, this event is your chance to engage directly with local businesses and entrepreneurs. Browse booths, make connections, and see what makes our local business community thrive. Then stick around for the Showcase Social from 5–7 PM to keep the conversations going over food, drinks, and good company! Please Note: All booths that remain set up throughout Showcase Social will be entered to win a full refund for their booth Showcase A ttendance is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC Showcase Social Tuesday, February 24, 2026 5:00 - 7:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center REGISTER HERE Stick around (or join us!) for the Showcase Social —an evening of tasting, toasting, and networking . Sample signature bites from local restaurants, enjoy beer and wine

description: Eagle Ranch Tuesday, March 3 9:00 - 10:00 AM 5500 Union Church Rd Flowery Branch, GA 30542 For 40 years Eagle Ranch has brought hope and healing to children and families in crisis. Come hear Executive Director John Shackelford share how their innovative whole-family approach is providing housing, education, and counseling to equip parents and children with powerful tools to restore relationships and rebuild trust. It’s a meaningful opportunity for local business leaders to learn, be encouraged, and explore how we can come alongside this mission. title: Small Business Seminar - How The UGA Small Business Development Center Can Help You Thrive in 2026!
description: Tuesday, March 10th Networking 8:15 - 8:30 AM Seminar 8:30 - 9:30 AM Join Tom Jones and Stephanie Sokenis to find out about the tools and resources available through your local UGA SBDC office to help you tackle the biggest challenges in your mature or startup business. One of the best small business resources you may not know about, the SBDC offers no-cost one-on-one consulting and a variety of training opportunities that support informed decision-making and long-term growth. During this session, attendees will learn how a business can use the SBDC to: Work one-on-one with a consultant at no cost to identify challenges, clarify goals, and plan next steps Use strategic planning to support decisions, growth initiatives, and operational improvements Analyze P&L, cash flow or capital acquisition opportunities Implement effective marketing strategies, digital marketing initiatives, and market research Enhance operations and efficiency, including systems, processes, and staffing considerations Powered in part by the U.S. Small Business Administration, the University of Georgia Small Business Development Center combines no-cost consultations and a variety of training workshops and classe

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Leading the Way in Neuroscience and Neurosurgical Care at NGHS
description: Michael Glanzman, Executive Director of Neurosciences for Northeast Georgia Health System and Dr. Zain Boghani, neurosurgeon with Northeast Georgia Physicians Group will offer a high-level overview of the Neuroscience service line at NGHS, featuring its comprehensive clinical programs and specialized teams. They will then dive deeper into the Neurosurgery program, exploring surgical treatment options and the seamless, coordinated care that defines the patient experience. Together, they will highlight how their multidisciplinary teams work together to serve and support communities throughout the region. Michael Glanzman, Executive Director of Neurosciences for Northeast Georgia Health System Zain Boghani, MD, neurosurgeon with Northeast Georgia Physicians Group If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

description: Join us for networking with beautiful lake views. Lanier Canoe & Kayak Club located at 3105 Clarks Bridge Rd., Gainesville, GA. Parking is free and we suggest everyone park in the Lanier Olympic park on the side of the blue building…. Enter through the black gate. Come enjoy the beautiful lake views and network with us! title: South Hall Business Coalition - King's Hawaiian
description: King's Hawaiian Thursday, April 21 9:00 - 10:00 AM 5425 Aloha Way Flowery Branch, GA 30542 Join us for an update and tour of the King's Hawaiian Bakery in South Hall County, where their flagship product, Hawaiian sweet bread, is produced. Tour attendees will see a state-of-the-art facility and learn what it takes to produce the irresistible sweet rolls from start to finish. Founded in 1955, the company has grown from a small bakery operation in Hawaii, to a distribution company selling bread, rolls, and pretzels bites nationwide. The family-owned food company expanded its Oakwood facility, creating more than 160 new jobs. This new 150,000-square-foot bakery is located across the street from the King's Hawaiian facility in Oakwood South Industrial Park. King's Hawaiian opened in Oakwood in 2010, and today provides over 800 jobs for the Hall County community. **Please note: space is LIMITED. Max 3 people per organization** REGISTER HERE $8.00 Member $15.00 Non-Member Light breakfast included 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: 118th Annual Gala
description: A Celebration of Legacy & Leadership Presented by the Board of Directors of the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce 118th Annual Meeting & Gala Thursday, May 7, 2026 6:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. The Boathouse at Lake Lanier Olympic Park We invite you to a lakeside evening of celebration marking the Chamber’s 118th year and honoring the leaders and businesses that shape our community. Set against the beautiful backdrop of Lake Lanier, this signature event features the presentation of Annual Business Awards, recognizing outstanding small and family-owned businesses, along with individual honors for exceptional leadership and distinguished service. The evening will also include the Passing of the Gavel, as we welcome our incoming executive leadership and usher in a new year for the Greater Hall Chamber. Black Tie Optional Sunset Cocktail Reception 6:00 p.m. Dinner & Program 7:30 p.m. $200 per person | $1,600 Table (seats 8) Sponsorships: Platinum $3,500 | Gold $2,500 6:00 PM- Outdoor Reception | 7:30 PM- Dinner and Program 230 E.E.
